data.title: Bob Hoskins Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Bob Hoskins with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Left school at 15

Claimed to have never taken an acting lesson

Before getting into acting, worked as a steeplejack, plumber's assistant and fire eater in the circus

Studied to be an accountant

Got his first acting job by accident: he accompanied a friend on an audition, wound up auditioning himself, and got the part

Was Brian De Palma's second choice, after Robert De Niro, to play Al Capone in 1987's The Untouchables

Announced his retirement in 2012 after being diagnosed with Parkinson's disease

Awards

2006Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Motion Picture: nominated

2001European Film Awards-European Actor: nominated

2001European Film Academy-Best European Actor: nominated

1999Genie Awards-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: winner

1997European Film Awards-European Actor: winner

1997European Film Academy-Best Actor: winner

1995Screen Actors Guild Awards-Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture: nominated

1989Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy: nominated

1987BAFTA Film Awards-Best Actor in a Leading Role: winner

1987Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture - Drama: winner

1986Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: nominated

1986Cannes Film Festival-Best Actor: winner

1986New York Film Critics Circle-Best Actor: winner

1985Los Angeles Film Critics Association-Best Actor: winner

1985National Society of Film Critics-Best Actor: winner

1984BAFTA Film Awards-Best Supporting Actor: nominated

1982BAFTA Film Awards-Best Actor: nominated
